channel.title: [PI] where to start?
channel.description: If i want to 1.How to add new buttons click where i add the button clicks? 2.how to add/delete npcs and how to add stuff. 3.where do i add the images for loading the interfaces (ithink its RSInterface.java) I found this in RSInterfac.java : Interfaces/Stuff/stuff.... [b]But i can find this folder.[/b] I never used a PI before.

item.title: [PI] where to start?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Sup22211, post:29, topic:511255”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=629500.msg4270698#msg4270698 date=1364507021]

No i am not… sk8 i added the folder “rule” to the cache. now in Rsinterface i load it (the method is above ^ ^ ^) now i want to figure out how to use this interface like:
showinterface(whatid?);
how to find buttons id (Like the buttons that are on quest tab)?

You need to add the “rule” folder to cache/sprites/interfaces/
[/quote]
I already understand this alone, but you still not explaining me this:
AND HOW DO I FIND BUTTON ID? (LETS SAY A BUTTON IN THE QUEST TAB)[/quote]
You click it.
And it should print to the cmd.
if not. You need to set up debugging.
Now stop being so angry about it, no one cares to help when you act like that.

Read full topic

Then open the .class in notepad.

item.title: [PI] where to start?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Sup22211, post:13, topic:511255”]I dont really know but i saw something called cachedir but it have only .PCK in it, also i having a problem with adding this interface:

public static void Rule(TextDrawingArea[] tda) {
RSInterface Interface = addScreenInterface(39012);
addSprite(39013, 1, "ServerInterfaces/Rules/BACKGROUND");
addHoverButton(39014, "ServerInterfaces/Rules/BUTTON", 0, 125, 40, "Accept", -1, 39015, 1);
addHoveredButton(39015, "ServerInterfaces/Rules/BUTTON", 1, 125, 40, 39016);
addText(39017, "1.No spamming!", tda, 1, 11702370, true, false);
setChildren(13, Interface);
setBounds(39012, 50, 50, 0, Interface);
setBounds(39013, 200, 226, 1, Interface);
setBounds(39017, 160, 110, 2, Interface);
}

And under aClass44 i added
‘Rule(TextDrawingArea);’
Its not an error but its keep logging me out at the end of the client loading so when i delete this method i get no errors.
AND HOW DO I FIND BUTTON ID? (LETS SAY A BUTTON IN THE QUEST TAB)[/quote]

Dude, stop with your shit.
Start from step one.
Which I said before, was finding your CACHE!
Open your signlink.java (Found in the “sign” folder).
Search for “String findcachedir()”
Look for where it says:
“return bla bla bla”
Post that line.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

I dont find the CacheDirectoryHere/Sprites/Interfaces/WhateverName/Images…
So i just added on client folder a new folder called ServerI then i made in that folder another folder called rules, okay so then i after i added all, the method called Rules
after aclass44 or something like this i added Rules(textdrawingblaalab); NOW its server sided? if so i go to ClickingButtons.java and how do i find the button id? and lets say i want a item/button will open my interface how do i do this? i know its showInterface(interfaceID); but how do i find the id?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] where to start?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You find the images in
CacheDirectoryHere/Sprites/Interfaces/WhateverName/Images
For instance, that starter stuff you posted:
CacheDirectoryHere/Sprites/Interfaces/Starter/BACKGROUND
Buttons are handled server side, but created client side.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] where to start?
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Exactly like this (Like the little interface when you open the server) anyway look i cant find a folder that i can load images from example:
I have only one folder in the client side and the folder called “sign” (just for you to know)
Then i open a file called “RSInterface” Then i founded a method :

	public static void Starter(TextDrawingArea[] tda) {
	RSInterface tab = addScreenInterface(15020);
	addSprite(15009, 0, "Interfaces/Starter/BACKGROUND");
	addHoverButton(15010, "Interfaces/Starter/WARRIOR", 3, 100, 100, "Choose Melee", -1, 15011, 1);
	addHoveredButton(15011, "Interfaces/Starter/WARRIORs", 0, 100, 100, 15051);
	addHoverButton(15012, "Interfaces/Starter/ARCHER", 1, 100, 100, "Choose Range", -1, 15013, 1);
	addHoveredButton(15013, "Interfaces/Starter/ARCHERs", 0, 100, 100, 15052);
	addHoverButton(15014, "Interfaces/Starter/MAGE", 2, 100, 100, "Choose Magic", -1, 15015, 1);
	addHoveredButton(15015, "Interfaces/Starter/MAGEs", 0, 100, 100, 15053);
	tab.totalChildren(7);
	tab.child(0, 15009, 5, 0);
	tab.child(1, 15010, 356, 132);
	tab.child(2, 15011, 356, 132);
	tab.child(3, 15012, 226, 132);
	tab.child(4, 15013, 226, 132);
	tab.child(5, 15014, 92, 132);
	tab.child(6, 15015, 92, 132);
	}

Idk what all this ^ ^ but do you see : ‘Interfaces/Starter/WARRIOR’
Lets say i will make a method like this and then load it, if i make a new folder in the client called “ServerI”
I could use this like this?

	public static void Starter(TextDrawingArea[] tda) {
	RSInterface tab = addScreenInterface(15020);
	addSprite(15009, 0, "Interfaces/Starter/BACKGROUND");
	addHoverButton(15010, "ServerI/Starter/WARRIOR", 3, 100, 100, "Choose Melee", -1, 15011, 1);
	addHoveredButton(15011, "ServerI/Starter/WARRIORs", 0, 100, 100, 15051);
	addHoverButton(15012, "ServerI/Starter/ARCHER", 1, 100, 100, "Choose Range", -1, 15013, 1);
	addHoveredButton(15013, "ServerI/Starter/ARCHERs", 0, 100, 100, 15052);
	addHoverButton(15014, "ServerI/Starter/MAGE", 2, 100, 100, "Choose Magic", -1, 15015, 1);
	addHoveredButton(15015, "ServerI/Starter/MAGEs", 0, 100, 100, 15053);
	tab.totalChildren(7);
	tab.child(0, 15009, 5, 0);
	tab.child(1, 15010, 356, 132);
	tab.child(2, 15011, 356, 132);
	tab.child(3, 15012, 226, 132);
	tab.child(4, 15013, 226, 132);
	tab.child(5, 15014, 92, 132);
	tab.child(6, 15015, 92, 132);
	}
